scenes.title: Homepage Exploration
scenes.narration: This is the React homepage, offering an overview of React's purpose and key features. Let's explore some of the content.

shots.text: React is the library for web and native user interfaces.

shots.narration: The menu button opens up a sidebar with navigation links.
Here are some quick links to different sections of the website.

scenes.title: Learning Resources
scenes.narration: Let's check out the learning resources provided on the website. These are great for beginners.

shots.narration: The Quick Start section has introductory tutorials.
Let's have a look at some of the topics covered.

scenes.title: API Documentation
scenes.narration: React provides comprehensive API documentation. Let's go through some of the sections.

shots.text: Find detailed information about React's API.
shots.narration: Here you'll find all you need to understand the various API offerings.
There are code examples and explanations of different components.
The search feature helps find specific API details quickly.

coverage: This demo showcases the React website's homepage, learning resources, and API documentation, including navigation, content exploration, and interactivity.
assumptions: Basic internet browsing capabilities and knowledge of web development concepts are assumed for the persona.
risks: Some users might have slow internet connections, which may impact the demo's pace.
Website content or layout changes could make some shots irrelevant.

segments.text: Welcome to the React website. This is the homepage, where you get an overview of React's capabilities. You can see the main navigation bar here, with links to different sections.
React focuses on helping you build user interfaces with components. The homepage gives a nice summary of its native user interface support.
Let's dive into the learning resources. There's a whole section dedicated to helping newcomers get started. It covers essential topics like creating and nesting components.
The API documentation is comprehensive. It has all the details you need on React's various functions. See? There's even a search feature to find specific API info.
You can also explore practical code examples, like this one demonstrating the SearchableVideoList.js component.
